website_summaries.verdict: High-quality clear epoxy resin is easy to use with a 1:1 mixture ratio.
pros: Once it sets, it delivers a strong protective layer
Odor-free epoxy resin coating that also resists yellowing
Product is made in the US, so you can count on the quality you're receiving
cons: May have a slight haze when using for casting

customer_reviews.title: ... resin brands trying to find which one has the greatest quantity for the price as well as works as ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying a lot of different resin brands trying to find which one has the greatest quantity for the price as well as works as expected. This resin is much thicker than any other brand of resin i've had but it works the best. The bubbles are minimized greatly and the casting is amazing when finished. I will be buying from here again. I do wish the sizes were larger but both half gallons mixed together makes one full gallon of resin I bought this a second time now and it really it the prettiest resin i've ever used it has a sheen to it that's so beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Guppy

customer_reviews.title: I did not like the product at all.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the product at all. I love what I've always used but was looking for better value and chose to try this based on the good reviews. For context: I used it for casting smaller objects. It felt really thick from the start and bubbles took to it very easily. At no point was it clear but instead had a haze. It hardened fine but was not as self leveling as I like and again had a terrible haze. If you're using this for painting or mixing pigment maybe these issues wouldn't matter. For casting when a crystal clear finish is expected I would highly suggest avoiding this product.
customer_reviews.author: MEH

customer_reviews.title: It works the best when it is warmed up!! Also pour it down the side of the mixing cup to avoid micro bubbles.
customer_reviews.text: I had a few questions because I wasn’t getting the result I was looking for. They sent me an email asking me if I liked the product. I told him that I had air bubbles and it wasn’t as clear as I would like it. I was using it for water in a vase. They answered me right back and gave me some pointers. They all worked great! The last projects I did worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... crystal clear also I had to find in the fine print that it is a max cast of 6oz
customer_reviews.text: not crystal clear also I had to find in the fine print that it is a max cast of 6oz. my project is 16oz and its is too late $100 down. This 6oz was not clearly stated.
customer_reviews.author: CJ_S

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product. Long pot life and consistent hardening
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. Long pot life and consistent hardening. The only downside is that it isnt a super hard product when set. But it is great to use for seal coating and void filling wood. It saves me from having to use the more expensive epoxy that I use for final coat. I am sure I will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Stinson

customer_reviews.title: Best Resin on the market
customer_reviews.text: I use this resin over canvas, metal and wood for artwork. It levels well and glides easily over any type of medium. Has a great pot life allowing multiple applications at one time for reduced waste. Gives vibrancy and depth to paints
customer_reviews.author: Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, it worked as described. I am making a resin inlay desk and I am pretty happy with the results. I did notice that if you stir up the product too much and / or pour too much resin at one time the product will heat up... a lot. I poured approximately 1/2 inch deep hole using 64 oz and the product started smoking and was hot to the touch, very unexpected but the pour turned out pretty good (aside from a few bubbles and the product cracking in a few places (probably from the heat).
customer_reviews.author: smashew

customer_reviews.title: Bubble issue
customer_reviews.text: This resin is absolutely awful. It's bubble prone no matter what you do. I talked to the company, did research, used my own experience and tried every possible technique. My casts...no matter how big or small, were completely riddled with bubbles. It ruined numerous pieces. I lost customers. I had to refund some people, because I can't sell pieces like this. At first I thought it was me. But i've used over half this kit trying to get it right to no avail. Other friends I know use this product and have been experiencing the same issues. I will never buy this resin again. I'd really prefer a refund
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Trustful review
customer_reviews.text: My first purchase of resin and as a beginner, works great! Self levels which eliminates excessive bubbles. I wish it cured faster so once I have used this up will most likely spend more $ on Ice Resin....great price, great product for the beginners.
customer_reviews.author: S & S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for newbies
customer_reviews.text: I had read that art resin was the best resin to use so I was skeptical buying this cheap one, but as a newbie I couldn't spend what art resin cost. To be honest art n glow is pretty awesome. My pieces dried in about about 6 hours which is a fraction of the time art resin takes. It does create more air bubbles even with slow stirring though. For anyone just starting out I definitely recommend art n glow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, better price
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving this product so far. I've done some of my best pour art using it. It does seem to have slightly more odor than the other product I was using, but it sets up just as nicely, seems to have fewer bubble issues and costs considerably less. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: wolf1997

customer_reviews.title: I have struck out with this resin!
customer_reviews.text: I have had success using several different types of resin, but have totally struck out with this one. I have a dining room table that I have coated three times with this resin. I'm still not happy with it. The coffee table that I just finished will also require another pour. Both of these pieces of furniture started out looking good and then develop depressions as the resin begins to cure. The only way to fix it is to sand it, wipe of the sanded surface, and pour again, except that doesn't fix it. I give up. I will buy another resin.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Love this Resin
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have used both more expensive and less expensive resins, but this is by far the best for me. This holds it's clear color, bubbles are easily removed by using a heat gun or torch and it dries in 24 hours. Try it, you will fall in love.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Luccas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE this resin it doesn’t require long time of mixing(only five minutes) and it gives u 40 minutes to working times, i used it for my school work projects all the time in facts I used the gallon size to cover 23 canvas( 11by14) and i had about 4 cups leftovers. I highly recommend this to everyone
customer_reviews.author: R.N

customer_reviews.title: Great only for pigments.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is thick! Upon mixing it, bubbles began to build right off the bat. Some were even floating out and floating around. It hardened nice but was super hazy. Using a heat gun only removed the bubbles that were coming to the top. The epoxy with pigment mixed in looks great but DO NOT USE FOR CLEAR APPLICATONS.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fun Product
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using resin, so I don’t have any other product experience to compare it to, but Art N Glow was easy to measure, mix, and pour. The resin, as promised, came out crystal clear. I used a heat gun both creatively for creating ripple effects in pigment, as well as over each layer to pop all the bubbles. I’ve ordered the gallon kit twice now, and both times the product arrived in perfect condition. Each bottle has a screw on cap, a foil seal under the cap, and for added security, the caps are taped on. Although this is a somewhat pricey medium to play with, the results are well worth it and highly addictive.
customer_reviews.author: LalaBb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent easy to work with Resin
customer_reviews.text: I coated TV trays after painting our local football team logo on them as a Christmas gift. Recipient loved them and now I have people asking if I'll make a set for them. Resin was easy to work with. If your doing a big project I recomend a thin coat first, I was able to reduce the amount of bubbles in my final pour by doing the thin one first. Turned out great! You MUST have a heart gun ot torch and a few toothpicks for deep bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only brand of resin I use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after purchasing smaller sized bottles of the same brand. So far, I've used these for over a dozen projects and I'm not even halfway through with them. I really like this brand of resin, it's actually the only one I use and have had no issues at all. As always, gloves and a respirator are recommended and even though this resin is low odor, it's always best to work in a well ventilated area.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY epoxy I will EVER buy again!
customer_reviews.text: So far so GREAT.... I was using another brand and it would start to harden within 20mins (it said 45 mins). I coated 2 tumblers, 1 phone holder mold, notebook mold and a LOT of earrings molds... Normally my old epoxy would have to be thrown away when I wouldn't even be 1/2 thru...BUT this stuff is AMAZING! I was able to get everything done ... And the tiny left is still perfectly able to be used!! This is the ONLY epoxy I will buy from now on!
customer_reviews.author: alanna stewart

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this unless you love bubbles.
customer_reviews.text: The amount of bubbles is ridiculous. I’ve had products where I have had bubbles and if I just throw a torch or a heat gun over it, it gets rid of a big majority. These are pictures/videos of a bunch of different methods and how not a single one could get rid of my bubbles. The product also came super yellow, but the other part didn’t come with a blue tint to counteract that, so I don’t understand why they’re selling a product that will yellow very quickly. Pretty annoyed that I spent so much money on this. Update: The company is nice, they issued a full refund. Hopefully what I got was just a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: selah

customer_reviews.title: Not hard at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of experience with resins but wanted to try something new. I mixed 3 different batches to use and it's been 3 days now that I did them and just about all my parts I did see still somewhat soft and not "Rock Hard" at all. I followed the instructions that came with the resin and didn't work. All I wanted was resin that would cure really hard and this ain't it. Waste of a $100....
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Best Resin I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have been using their products for couple years already, never had any issues. Clear instructions, fast responsive customer service. They are not only have good quality products also have best customer services. They gives you tips on how to make the best out of their resin and what to avoid. No bad smells like other resin and great 40 minutes working time.
customer_reviews.author: RRRSW

customer_reviews.title: Making offshore lures with this material is the TRICK
customer_reviews.text: Casting lures the size of a coffee cup you want glass clear resin. This is it. Pressure pot relieves small bubbles. Art and Glow also has superior glow powder for deep water glow beads. Have had no cracking or problems around Mylar or lead in castings as with other products !!
customer_reviews.author: Twoturnin

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again when I run out
customer_reviews.text: I reall like the out come. I definitely will buy the 16oz version First and start filling it up with the gallon as I go for more control I was pretty good at first when started using it but now since it's almost halfway is lower in the container it's harder to control how much I pour. I bought this 3 times had little to no problems unless the rooms get a little cold then it wouldn't cure all the way. I wish there was a save and subscribe option.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay. I use it to make jewelry and art pieces but when my products are outside, they become soft and bendable. This is the second type of resin I’ve used so I’m not sure if that’s normal. It also says it’s odor free but it definitely hasn’t a strong smell to it. I always wear a mask when pouring but checks on me to make sure I don’t pass out lol the smell gives her a headache. I probably won’t buy this again but you do get a lot for how much it’s worth
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but maybe not for placing heavy objects.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, very easy to use. Used it for a bar top. Cured for weeks before our first use. Wine and liquor bottles set on top left ring indentations in the surface. Was very surprised something that light would leave an impression.
customer_reviews.author: TMH

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I like how they kept it simple with a 1:1 mix ratio. It takes pigments (I’ve used acrylic paint, glow powder, and pearl pigment powder) very well. Haven’t had any huge issues with bubbles in the molds I’m using, especially considering they are slightly over the 6oz recommended amount for casting molds for a single pour. It cures very strong and fairly quickly for molds which is a huge bonus. Will be applying this to a flat piece soon to test out the flood coat capabilities, but I’m not expecting it to disappoint. Thanks for the great product. Will be ordering another kit soon
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Clear! No bubbles! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! I really didn't have a hard time with bubbles, like some of the other few reviews have said. I mixed til it was clear and at a slow pace, used my heat gun, torch, per usual, no problem! It's super clear! Also, the mold I have, wasn't smooth, this isn't an advice post, but i merely made a small batch again and poured it over my cured mold and walla! Crystal clear, no yellow. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions and know it will generate lots of heat when setting
customer_reviews.text: The directions left a lot to be figured out on your own. They pour was a 1” thick 1-1/2” wide river table and it went well until the epoxy started to set. The heat being generated caused some surface foaming that could not be smoothed. All in all it seems like a decent epoxy that just needs a little more direction to get perfect
customer_reviews.author: dischmond

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this highly
customer_reviews.text: Started working with resin about a year ago and this is the best value for the easiest to work with I've found. If done properly with a heat gun or a pressure pot, your peice will come out crystal clear. Its worked great with several different kinds of pigments both liquid and powder. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Gare B

customer_reviews.title: This resin is awesome - I'm using it to fill and cover a ...
customer_reviews.text: This resin is awesome - I'm using it to fill and cover a raw edge wood slab. and was able to use the excess to reattach the hanging frame of a stained glass lamp shade to the glass and repair a 3' resin frog butler on which the load bearing (tray holding) arm had broken off. Dries clear and hard, easy to use, clear directions - mix completely in equal parts and pour
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Shuken

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I started using this product. It was going good the first half of my project. Came out the next day to find it had cracked in five different places. Had to buy more and had poured more and came out to check on it an hour later to find my garage filled with smoke which was coming off my project and left me coughing like crazy. Then came back an hour later to find it had cracked again. I’m not happy with this. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: First off, I am not experienced at all in using acrylic... BUT I will say that I was very surprised at how hot this gets when it's setting. ALSO, it was very difficult to get stuff to kinda suspend in the liquid. It either sank all the way to the bottom or floated.
customer_reviews.author: NorEsBo

customer_reviews.title: This is a must buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the only resin I’ll ever use. I absolutely love this stuff. It’s easy to use, the smell isn’t strong, and the finished products are always remarkable. I’ve bought more of this resin on amazon than I’ve bought anything else haha, and I buy a lot of stuff off of this site. I will always recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Results
customer_reviews.text: Found this product easy to use with dependable results. Used for making jewelry. First time using resins and needed something with low to no odor and easy to work with. This was both with crystal clear results when used as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my 2nd gallon kit of this last week. I find it very good for the art projects I use it for. I have not tested it for yellowing with age/UV exposure though. This seems to be one of two good non-toxic brands on the market and a little less $ than the other. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: la

customer_reviews.title: This is my 4th time using the clear casting. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th time using the clear casting. I have found it very manageable to use and certainly meets its description. The shipping is really quick and that’s very exciting as I’m usually chomping at the bit to get on with my project. I have used mainly on wood projects so far but I’m branching out. Many thanks.
customer_reviews.author: mike webb

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value, Great Service
customer_reviews.text: The kit arrived quickly, and it has been incredibly convenient to use. I switched from this seller's 16 oz kit because the gallon kit is half the cost per oz. The resin is easy to pour and to mix. I have been using Art N Glow resin because it is the first resin I've bought that has cured as advertised, and I have been very satisfied with the results. My purchase also came with a discount coupon for my next order, which is the extra touch that caused me to leave this review. I am very likely to purchase this item again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product with great potential
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product I used it to make a resin table. If you have patience and an average understanding of the material and read the instructions it’s the product for you. This product does take time It says “24 hour cure time” but this does depend on environmental conditions. Mine cured in roughly 12-16 hours and I did two pours in 36 hours to complete that project.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great resin best I have ever used. It's thicker then what I'm use to and was skeptical on how it would work, but it's amazing. Just need to wait a little longer to pour after being mixed to reduce bubbles. Over all wonderful. Looking forward to buying more
customer_reviews.author: swede

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I used this resin to make a gift for my sister. It was very easy to use it was a little messy but I'm a klutz so that was probably my fault. The gift came out amazing and it cured pretty quickly!! Love it!! I will be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This was a big waste of money. I don’t know if I got a bad batch or what but unfortunately, I had to throw away more than 50% of the work I did while using this. I’m not a beginner and this by far has been the worst resin I have ever work with. TMy work wouldn’t cured or it would bend like I the pictures I posted. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Mouraclan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Long working time. Easy 1 to 1 ratio for mixing. Some odor but nothing over powering, would recommend good ventilation while using. Very clear when cured. With correct mixing the bubbles are minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Cures Hard!
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the directions thoroughly and allow your project to fully cure undisturbed for a week you will get a beautifully clear and hard cure. I've tested it out by covering a plank of wood and got very good results. Next is my old dinning room table. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rashidah

customer_reviews.title: Great for resin projects
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I dislike that it got dry too fast while I was still working. Overall, the outcome when it dries is beautiful. It's clear as glass! Just be careful not to use too much heat it'll cause bubbles. Definitely great product but still found it too pricy.
customer_reviews.author: OneNastyBBW89

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I have used lots of different brands of resin. This one is by far the best. Fewest bubbles. Sets slow, so you have plenty of time to work with it. Levels out the best. Is the most”fluid”. There are cheaper brands, but at the least, use this for your final coats for the best self-leveling.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Howard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with costly results
customer_reviews.text: This resin is difficult to mix and if you’re using it for crafts, alcohol ink does not sink into it. It is sticking to my molds and I now have to replace several of my molds from damage. I don’t know what the resin is for but it’s not meant for silicon molds
customer_reviews.author: Strider

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: I love art n glow resin and I was buying the smaller size for a few months and decided to get the bigger one. This is a better value than the smaller sizes if you use resin a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ylmpastmidnight

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: I’m always very hesitant to try new things, especially with a high price tag. However, I was pleasantly surprised. This epoxy is great. No harsh fumes, and cures crystal clear. No issues at all. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: This my go to now. Work very well a crystal clear resin. And cures pretty quickly starts setting after 45 minutes. I leave it in the kitchen to cure overnifht
customer_reviews.author: My business

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use this product!  My star rate is. 0
customer_reviews.text: I would everything 0! After spending a lot of money and time it was useless. I hired a professional. The product was NOT advertised as unable to use on an older surface. My bar has been stripped x2, the stuff was applied as instructed. My professional called a place close by us that sells it and they said they were sorry they couldn’t help but we did directions exactly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best resin I have used so far...
customer_reviews.text: I have been in trial and error mode with resin crafting. This brand has done everything I have needed it to do in less time than any other brand I have used. I am really happy to say that this brand has great customer service and I will continue to purchase it...
customer_reviews.author: L Hershkovitz

customer_reviews.title: No Odor!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have ordered this product! And it won't be the last. It would be nice if there were pumps for the bigger bottles. It's heavy for lifting. I'm using funnels for getting the stuff in the big bottle into a smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Pistor

customer_reviews.title: No smell
customer_reviews.text: I revived this as a gift at first try. I really liked it and can’t smell anything. Going on my 3rd time around and I haven’t had any negative results yet. I also heard the warmer the resin the less bubbles. So I tried both ways and it’s true. You definitely want your resin at least 75 degrees or warmer. Then popping the little bubbles with a torch
customer_reviews.author: Chere

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to resin for all my projects an especially when I do my resin art !! I will not use any other resin this comes out nice an clear ! But remember to warm your resin before using it sooo you get less bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product I have been ordering this product for over a year I have purchased approximately 20 gallons. Love it .
customer_reviews.author: tamracorwin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying this brand for about a year now and just started buying the gallon size. I use a gallon in about 3 months for my business. I love working with this resin I have never had an issue with it. The resin always turns out crystal clear
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: No offense, but shop around first !
customer_reviews.text: Way to expensive!!!! Please be aware of the the hardener and how it reacts with certain plastics , otherwise you end up like me and have a horrible chemical reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea tsoukalas-adams

customer_reviews.title: Mix slow and for a little - be patient
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and it has proved to be my favorite resin thus far. Be sure when you are mixing that you slowly mix and mix for a little bit. I have learned that being patient goes a looooooong way. Mixes very well with alcohol inks and over my acrylic paintings
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Leigh Miller

customer_reviews.title: BEST RESIN BRAND! PERIOD POOH💯
customer_reviews.text: I love that I only used 1/3 of the containers already and earned the money back I spent on them. Hate that it’s sticky, but this brand is THE BEST NON-yellowing resin and also does not bend nor are you able to dent it after it cures.
customer_reviews.author: Libby B.

customer_reviews.title: Yellows over time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and used this for jewelry and various mixed media over a year ago and I recently noticed that all of the jewelry that I made with it has yellowed. Not happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Girl

customer_reviews.title: This is really good stuff that works very well if you use it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really good stuff that works very well if you use it correctly. Make sure to mix thoroughly and definitely keep your piece away from dust as it will get caught and ruin your piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Shields

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works but reacts to oils of any kind and have to use a second coat.
customer_reviews.author: Gail M

customer_reviews.title: Product is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The resin is very clear with no yellowing so far (poured a few weeks ago). Product is easy to use. It is a bit thicker than other resins I have used, but that might have been due to the cool temperature on the day I was pouring. All in all, I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns yellow looks dingy. Cant return because I didn't notice yellow until too late
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset with how yellow my painted rocks turned out . And because its passed the 3o day return . I can not return this. I ordered it in November. Never used it until easter and every rock i used this on turned yellow and dingy and look so dirty. Inpaid slot and am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Aprylle anacleto

customer_reviews.title: Good Epoxy
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality epoxy! The only issues is the smell and that it cures pretty quick. So be sure to be ready to pour your resin soon before it thickens too much. Other than that its my go to!
customer_reviews.author: Prisilla

customer_reviews.title: Clear results
customer_reviews.text: Resin is easy to mix and has sufficient working time for my project. it is well set within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Spend more and get batter epoxy
customer_reviews.text: I have used other epoxy with success, but this one has left a bunch of soft spots on two projects. It was mixed as directed in smaller batches and still came out bad. I guess that's what I get for trying the cheap stuff
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: My favorite resin
customer_reviews.text: Of all the types of resin I have tried this is by far my favorite it has no strong smell and is easy to measure and mix and my favorite part of you get it on your hands it isn't like removing superglue it can be washed of with just a little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RESIN! GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I started up resin projects during the pandemic & I started out with this brand because of the great price and I have been using it ever since! Not only is the price great but the quality is incredible and it works wonders each time! This is now my 5th order from the company & each time they are very nice and reach out if I need anything. Highly recommend! Will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Boroumand

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot
customer_reviews.text: Is was difficult to get the bubbles out, even when you mix the proper amounts and use suggested techniques. It should also be known that you can not use this product on something that may be sensitive to heat. Using exact measurements, it still gets quite hot. I recommend for smaller or thin layered products. It should work well for that.
customer_reviews.author: ChopperJockey

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear
customer_reviews.text: Great overall resin for my small scale projects. Crystal clear when used by itself and great with liquid resin dyes and pearlescent powders. It stands up well to sanding and drilling too. Occasionally there are bubbles when casting in a mold that’s too deep or convoluted to properly use a heat gun on, so there is a little learning curve with pouring depending on the complexity of the piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Epoxy for ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Art n Glow Epoxy...easy to use little to no bubbles and clear coat every time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tori Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great resin!
customer_reviews.text: First time resin user and this brand has been great! I don’t have much to compare to but I haven’t wanted to buy other brands as i have re bought this 3 times. East 1:1 mixing ratio. About 40 minute work time. Just stir nice and slow and bubbles will be at minimum!
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is clear. I use in wood turning (bowls).
customer_reviews.author: Randy39507

customer_reviews.title: Alot for your money
customer_reviews.text: We use this for jewelry making, no complaints, customer service is wonderful, contact them through Facebook and they respond fast, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ian R.

customer_reviews.title: It is very important to mix epoxy for the entire 3 minutes or until clear.  This is true for any epoxy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as describe. We have tried several different epoxy resins and this one covered the best on the first coat. I also loved the instructions that came with this product. Very clear and easy to understand. I WILL be purchasing this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Defective batch
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t work ruined my project. It turned green. Maybe was defective bottle can’t say
customer_reviews.author: Shelly a

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Art ’N Glow for a while now and will continue to use it. It’s a good value and I haven’t had any problems with it. I am using a pressure chamber to cast my particular project because of the depth of the mold and the fine detail.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Not curing
customer_reviews.text: I have a few monthsof experience doing resin. But this brand is new to me, i honestly dont know whats wrong with it but it's not curing correctly. I tried extra mixing it. I do the 1:1 portion. Temperature is okay. I leave it to cure for a day. And nothing has work. My pieces are bemdable and flexible
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Bubbly
customer_reviews.text: It comes right out of the container super bubbly so unless you have a pressure pot (which i don't) its really hard to get the bubbles out. Its a thicker epoxy which I personally don't like. Im just not really happy with this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha dupie

customer_reviews.title: Poor working resin
customer_reviews.text: This resin is very hard to work with. Very thick and doesn't mix well with pigments. Hard to put on tumblers. Takes forever to harden and cure. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and not as fussy as other resins
customer_reviews.text: Much easier and less fussy then enviro Tec and much better color worth the extra cost if you need to do and resin work where clearity is key
customer_reviews.author: aaron m.

customer_reviews.title: Great product but expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best epoxies I have ever used, it cures fast and there was very little bubble, which with the help of heat gun they all gone easily and quickly. The outcome is great, it is clear and. My only complain is its price, I would have give it 5 star if it was cheaper. This is expensive enough that make is impossible for me to use it again for tables.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buying on a monthly basis
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, have used several times to make a multitude of resin objects and crafts. Great price for quality and quantity. Scent isn't that bad, just make sure to follow instructions and use in a well ventilated area.
customer_reviews.author: Weednelious III

customer_reviews.title: Works, but best for small projects
customer_reviews.text: •cures way too fast (for me) allowing very little time to manipulate Good for small projects I’d guess .
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Best On The Market
customer_reviews.text: Art N Glow is a reliable resin mix. Prepared at the right temp (75-80F) it mixes smooth, minimal bubbles, and is crystal clear. I will continue to use this product in all my work!
customer_reviews.author: Jenni B

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this stuff, easy to use and no odor.
customer_reviews.author: TeamHowards

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy, great product to use. We used it to seal in our 9 pet headstones, so we needed a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is clear and cures properly!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, does not bubble up too much being that it is on the thicker side. Has no smell and easy to use. Comes with easy to read instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great results!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first resin into a silicone mold project I’ve done so I expected for the first few to be a wash...they were beautiful! This product yields professional quality results for sure. It comes with clear instructions that even a fist time user can achieve. Recommend and will purchase for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Honore Young

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this resin. It has a low scent and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Erdbrink

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am pleased. The product works although I have had fails which may be more on my minimla expertise. I think it is worth the price and at that well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Chunker

customer_reviews.title: Art n glow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use fast shipping. Had one issue with a particular color additive. Other than that so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: My first couple of pours had a little to many bubbles. I think it had more to do with technique. Once I mixed slower it was better.
customer_reviews.author: anna r watkins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of this resin. You can add any color to it and get interesting and amazing results
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Heat resin in warm bucket of water to reduce bubbling!
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t have any complaints with the resin. I’ve been making resin pieces for about 2 years now and this is by far my favorite brand. I did have troubles with very small bubbles but learned from the other reviews how to stop it from happening. I make pieces for family and friends for now, it’s by far my favorite craft to do now
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this seller, great product worked as described.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this product, all was as described by seller. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mex

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: very good product at a reasonable price. I will be ordering again soon. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No yellowing
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded to the 1 gallon option because I love this resin so much! With heat gun no bubbles and no yellowing. It mixes with pigment well and works great for acrylic resin pours on canvas!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

product_meta.title: Clear Casting and Coating Epoxy Resin - 1 Gallon Kit
feature_bullets: Use our clear epoxy resin for all of your casting AND coating applications. Hardens crystal clear and hard as a rock
Rigorous testing was done to ensure that our resin is a perfect match for all of our glow in the dark and other craft pigments
Our resin is self leveling, self degassing, odor free, resistant to yellowing from sun exposure, and is made in the U.S.A.
One to one mix ratio is fool proof and has a forgiving 40 minute work time
Use to coat tables and bars, encapsulate objects, cast figurines and jewelry, make resin paintings and more
